Bind a device array to the texture reference.

Any previously bound memory will be unbound.

array the array to bind

unsigned int cuda::TextureReference::bind ( const DevicePtr &  ptr,
int  size 
) const

Bind a linear address range to the texture reference.

Any previously bound memory will be unbound.

Since the hardware enforces an alignment requirement to texture base addresses, this function returns a byte offset that must be applied to texture fetches. This offset must be divided by the texel size and passed to the kernels that read from the texture so that they can be applied to the texture1Dfetch() function. If the device memory pointer was returned from cuda::malloc, the offset is guaranteed to be 0.

Parameters:
ptr the device pointer to the texture memory
size the size of the texture
Returns:
the byte offset for texture fetches.
